timeline.message:
chore(aws-datastore): clarify hub event names

The `DataStoreChannelEventName` enumeration contained two generations of
event names:

 1. An initial set, which included `RECEIVED_FROM_CLOUD`, and
    `PUBLISHED_TO_CLOUD`;
 2. A larger set, containing many more, exposing various internal
    details of the syncrhonization engine.

The work that went in for (2) was partially duplicate of (2).

This commit *removes* the `PUBLISHED_TO_CLOUD`, which was duplicated by
the `OUTBOX_MUTATION_PROCESSED` event in phase (2).

This commit *renames* the `RECEIVED_FROM_CLOUD` event to
`SUBSCRIPTION_DATA_PROCESSED`.

timeline.bodyText: can we clarify that this is not shared across the platforms and that this is for internal use only?
timeline.author: raphkim
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -51,14 +42,16 @@
     NETWORK_STATUS("networkStatus"),
 
     /**
-     * The websocket connection has been established and all the graphql subscriptions too.
+     * The WebSocket connection has been established, in addition to all of the GraphQL
+     * subscriptions it hosts.
      */
     SUBSCRIPTIONS_ESTABLISHED("subscriptionsEstablished"),
 
     /**
-     * The DataStore as a whole (not just the sync piece) is ready. At this point all data is available.
+     * The server sent the client data over the WebSocket subscription. The data was
+     * successfully melded back into the local store.
      */
-    READY("ready"),
+    SUBSCRIPTION_DATA_PROCESSED("subscriptionDataProcessed"),

replies.bodyText: I think we can achieve that by omitting it from the public docs, for now. It might make sense for the other platforms to add this, later?
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: wouldn't this have been a stronger assertion?
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText:
It was duplicative logic. The isProcessed filter already checks for the model type and ID. So if the accumulator even gets an event, it means we did find this match, already.
In other words, this assertion is sort of just testing the isProcessed filter again.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: where was this being used before?
timeline.author: raphkim
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -180,22 +180,4 @@
             }
         }, failure -> onNotPresent.call());
     }
-
-    /**
-     * The strategy to use while merging. Whether to consider the contents of the mutation
-     * outbox before saving data locally, or, to ignore it.
-     */
-    enum MergeStrategy {
-        /**
-         * When merging, the contents of the mutation outbox will *not* be considered.
-         */
-        IGNORE_PENDING_MUTATIONS,
-
-        /**
-         * When merging, the contents of the mutation outbox will be considered.
-         * If there is already a pending mutation in the mutation outbox, for a model of the
-         * same ID as the model being merged -- then the merge will *not* modify the existing model.
-         */
-        CONSIDER_PENDING_MUTATIONS
-    }

replies.bodyText:
There use to be some logic to change the behavior depending on whether the change was outbound, or inbound.
If outbound, the mutation outbox would have a pending mutation, while being merged. So, we'd have to not consider it.
The issue was later remedied by changing the sequence of events, so that the event gets removed from the outbox before being merged.
But, this enum apparently didn't removed in that previous change.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: should we put all these inside TestHubEventFilters as isProcessed() and isReceived() for consistency?
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: I wish. The problem is that TestHubEventFilters lives in aws-datastore/src/test, and this file is in aws-datastore/src/androidTest. I evaluated a few workaround to that hurdle, but none were very elegant. If I moved it to testutils, then testutils needs to depend on the DataStore plugin module, and that doesn't seem right.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: Ah shoot, I think I vaguely remember this being an issue when I was writing the tests :/
replies.author: raphkim
